p: To predict possible huemul environment distribution shifts, either in relation to their current location or to suitable habitat, estimated models were converted to binary maps (0, not suitable; 1, suitable). Next, we used a threshold that maximizes sensitivity and specificity to balance commission and omission errors ( Liu, White & Newell, 2013). Projections for years 2050 and 2070 GCM models were added to generate a concordance map with values ranging from 1 (where just one model estimated habitat suitability) to 5 (where all models match). Then, we used only the estimated concordance area of three GCMs. The resulting map of current estimated huemul distribution was compared to its distribution proposed by IUCN (2016). At the same time, a comparison was made between current distribution maps and the two future projections from climate change. All calculations were performed in the QGIS 2.12 ( Quantum GIS DevelopmentÂ Team, 2016).
